intro: Mappia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly mappia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its fruit is a rough, spiny capsule that contains several seeds. Mappia tomentosa is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
